intro: Stenocarpha filipes, commonly known as the slenderleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Stenocarpha filipes is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
